intro: Eurycaulis crabro, commonly known as the hairy crabro, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eurycaulis crabro produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
